comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Arthur Alfred Lynch (16 October 1861 – 25 March 1934) was an Irish Australian civil engineer, physician, journalist, author, soldier, anti-imperialist and polymath. ... During World War I, Lynch volunteered for the New British Army. He raised a private 10th Batt. Royal Munster Fusiliers and was given the rank of Colonel, although he and his unit never saw active front service." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arthur_Alfred_Lynch
